name: ANUPQ
body:
### Description
The ANUPQ package provides an interactive interface to the p-quotient, p-group generation and standard presentation algorithms of the ANU pq C program. It has been tested on Linux, Mac OS X and Windows (using Cygwin), and more generally should work on any Unix compatible operating system.

### Installation and Requirements
Detailed installation instructions are contained in the package README file.

ANUPQ has the following requirements:
* GAP version 4.4 or newer (we recommend using at least GAP 4.6).
* The [AutPGrp](http://www.gap-system.org/Packages/autpgrp.html) package.
* A working C compiler.

### Online Documentation
Here is the documentation of the **ANUPQ** package in several output formats. If you have installed the package as described above you can also access all of these documents from the **GAP** online help.
* [HTML-version](http://www.gap-system.org/Manuals/pkg/anupq/htm/chapters.htm)
* [pdf-version](http://www.gap-system.org/Manuals/pkg/anupq/doc/manual.pdf)

Documentation of the (standalone) pq C program is also available
* [pdf-version](http://school.maths.uwa.edu.au/~gregg/ANUPQ/standalone-doc/guide.pdf)

### Package Archives for Download
The **ANUPQ** package is available in several formats:
* anupq-3.1.zip
* anupq-3.1.tar.gz (GNU tar archive, gzip'ed)


### Contact
ANUPQ authors: Eamonn O'Brien, Werner Nickel, Greg Gamble.
Current maintainers: [Greg Gamble](mailto:Greg.Gamble@Math.RWTH-Aachen.De), [Max Horn](max.horn@mathematik.jlu-giessen.de).
